title: Los Angeles County MEHKO
description: LA County MEHKO (excludes Pasadena, Long Beach, Vernon). Up to 30 meals/day, 90/week, $100k cap.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
- [Download How to Get Started Guide](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/business/MEHKO_HowToGetStarted-English.pdf)
- [Download Self-Inspection Checklist](http://ph.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/business/MEHKO_Self-InspectionChecklist-English.pdf)
- [Visit LA County MEHKO Program Website](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh)
- Ensure your kitchen & menu align with MEHKO rules and requirements

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
- Get landlord approval (if renting)
- [Find CFPM Training Programs](https://www.foodprotectionmanager.com/)
- [Check City Business License Requirements](https://www.lacity.org/business)
- [Register for Sales Tax](https://www.cdtfa.ca.gov/)
- [Check ABC License Requirements](https://www.abc.ca.gov/) (if serving alcohol)

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
- **SOP Form**: Complete in Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- **Health Permit Application**: Complete in Step 5: Health Permit Application
- CFPM certificate (from Step 2)
- Food Handler Cards (if employees) - [Get Training Here](https://www.foodhandler.com/)
- Water test results (if using private well) - [Find Testing Labs](https://www.waterquality.org/)

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content: Fill out and submit the SOP form. This is where you'll complete the Standard Operating Procedures document. [Download SOP Template](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/business/MEHKO_SOP-English.pdf)

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content: Complete and submit the official Public Health Permit Application. This is where you'll fill out the main permit form. [Download Application Form](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/business/MEHKO_PublicHealthPermitApplication-ENG.pdf)

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
- Submit the completed forms from Steps 4 & 5
- Pay $597 review fee (unless subsidized)
- [Submit Online](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh) or mail to LA County Environmental Health
- [Payment Methods Accepted](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/payment)

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
- Department will contact you to schedule inspection
- [Inspection Checklist](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/business/MEHKO_Self-InspectionChecklist-English.pdf)
- Fix any issues found during inspection
- Complete follow-up inspections if required

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content: Permit will be mailed upon approval. Processing typically takes 2-4 weeks after inspection approval.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
- Follow approved SOP from Step 4
- Notify program of changes within 20 days
- Stay within $100k/year, 30/day, 90/week limits
- [Food Safety Guidelines](http://www.publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/docs/safety/guide-food-safety-your-home-kitchen-en.pdf)
- [Annual Renewal Requirements](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/renewal)

steps.title: Limited-Time Subsidy
steps.content: Fee waiver available for first 1,000 applicants (net revenue < $50k, no prior subsidy). Deadline: June 30, 2026 or until funds run out. [Apply for Subsidy](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh/subsidy)

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**Home-Based Food Operations Program**
ðŸ“ž Phone: (626) 430-9855
ðŸ“§ Email: [homebasedfoods@ph.lacounty.gov](mailto:homebasedfoods@ph.lacounty.gov)
ðŸŒ Website: [LA County Environmental Health MEHKO Program](http://publichealth.lacounty.gov/eh)
ðŸ“ Office Hours: Monday-Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM

title: San Diego County MEHKO
description: San Diego MEHKO program. Up to 30 meals/day (90/week) and $100,000 gross sales cap; with approved pushcarts: 80/day (200/week) and $150,000 cap.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
- Confirm MEHKOs are allowed countywide (they are) and you must operate from your **primary residence** (no second homes/RVs). If renting or in an HOA, verify your lease/CC&Rs allow a home business. 
- **Operating limits:** Up to **30 meals/day** and **90/week**; **gross annual sales â‰¤ $100,000** (indexed to CPI). If you also operate up to **two pushcarts (CMFOs)** approved as part of your MEHKO, limits increase to **80/day** and **200/week** with **$150,000** cap (indexed). Keep sales logs.
- **Same-day service only:** Prepare and serve on the **same day**; no leftovers to next day.
- **Food constraints:** No raw milk, no raw oysters, no ROP/vacuum sealing/canning, no HACCP-required processes (smoking for preservation, curing, acidification, etc.). Alcohol requires ABC license.
- **Animals & kids:** Must be kept out of kitchen/dining during prep/service.
- **May serve as commissary for up to two CMFOs you own** (with written DEHQ approval).

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
- **Landlord/HOA/Zoning:** Get landlord/HOA approval if applicable. For land use/zoning questions, contact **County PDS Zoning** (general line **(858) 565-5981**) or your city planning dept.
- **Food Safety Manager (CFPM):** The MEHKO operator must pass an **approved Food Safety Manager** exam **before** applying. Keep certificate on site.
- **Food Handler Cards:** Anyone (besides the operator) who handles food must obtain a **Food Handler Card within 10 days** of starting work; keep proof on site.
- **Optional:** If doing any structural work, check with your local **Building Department** first.

actions.label: Ask AI about CFPM options
actions.aiPrompt: Help me choose an ANSI-CFP Food Safety Manager course near San Diego and explain time, cost, and passing tips.

actions.label: Search courses
actions.query: ANSI-CFP Food Safety Manager certification San Diego

actions.label: Search food handler training
actions.query: San Diego County approved food handler card course

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
- **MEHKO Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)** â€” complete in **Step 4**.
- **Public Health Permit Application (Form 152)** â€” complete in **Step 5**.
- **Proposed menu** (same-day prep/service; list any CMFO use).
- **CFPM certificate** (operator).
- **Food Handler Cards** (any employees; obtain within 10 days of starting).
- **Water testing results** (*only if on a private well* â€” full panel).
- **Optional/if applicable:** CMFO details if you will operate pushcarts under your MEHKO.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content: Complete the SOP form for your home kitchen (food flow, sanitizing, allergen controls, same-day service, pet/kid controls, waste, delivery, etc.). This is a required document. (If another step references SOP, see **Step 4**.)

steps.title: Health Permit Application (Form 152)
steps.content: Fill out the **DEHQ Public Health Permit Application (Form 152)** for a new MEHKO. Include owner info, site address (primary residence), and select the MEHKO category. (If another step mentions the application, see **Step 5**.)

steps.title: Submit Application & Pay Fees
steps.content:
- **What to submit:** (1) **Form 152** (Step 5), (2) **MEHKO SOP** (Step 4), (3) **Menu**, (4) **CFPM certificate**, (5) **Food Handler cards** if applicable, (6) **Well water test** if on private well.
- **Where/how to submit & pay:**
  - **Online payment:** pay fees at **dehqpay.com**.
  - **Email submissions & questions:** **FHDpermits@sdcounty.ca.gov**.
  - **In person:** DEHQ, **5500 Overland Ave, Suite 170, San Diego, CA 92123**.
  - **Mail:** DEHQ, **P.O. Box 129261, San Diego, CA 92112-9261** (allow **up to 2 weeks** for mail processing).
- **Fees (MEHKO â€“ Food Facility Permit Fees):** **Initial permit: $673**; **Annual renewal: $335**; **Updated SOP review: Varies**; Complaint response and re-inspection fees may apply.

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
- After DEHQ approves your application/SOP, they will **schedule an initial inspection at your residence**.
- Be ready to demonstrate: same-day preparation/service; temperature control; sanitation; handwash and utensil facilities; allergen and contamination controls; pet/child separation during operations; delivery/pick-up controls; and any CMFO procedures.
- **Ongoing:** Expect **one routine inspection per year**; additional reinspections/complaint responses as needed (fees may apply).

steps.title: Receive Your Permit
steps.content:
- **Review timeline:** If your application is **complete and detailed**, DEHQ's review is **up to 20 calendar days**. If revisions are required, allow **+10 days** for re-review.
- Permit is issued **after the initial inspection verifies compliance**. Display your permit (or a legible copy) during hours of operation.

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
- **Limits:** **â‰¤30 meals/day, â‰¤90/week; â‰¤$100,000 gross sales/year** (CPI-adjusted). With approved CMFO pushcarts as part of your MEHKO: **â‰¤80/day, â‰¤200/week; â‰¤$150,000/year** (CPI-adjusted). Keep **meal/sales logs**.
- **Same-day only:** No next-day leftovers. Prepare and serve all food the same day.
- **No prohibited processes/products:** No raw milk/raw oysters; no ROP/vac sealing/canning; no smoking/curing/acidification as preservation; no HACCP processes without specific allowance; no unlicensed ice cream manufacture; alcohol only with **ABC** license.
- **Labeling/packaging:** You may portion meals for same-day pick-up/delivery; **no reduced-oxygen packaging**.
- **Changes:** Menu or operation changes may require an **updated SOP**â€”contact DEHQ before changing.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**Department of Environmental Health & Quality (DEHQ)**
- Phone (program/FAQs): **(858) 505-6900**
- Permits email: **FHDpermits@sdcounty.ca.gov**
- Office: **5500 Overland Ave, Suite 170, San Diego, CA 92123**
- Mailing: **P.O. Box 129261, San Diego, CA 92112-9261**
- Website: **sdcdehq.org** (Food & Housing Division)
- **Zoning questions:** County PDS **(858) 565-5981** or your city planning department.

title: Lake County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales. Plan Check $135/hr (1 hr minimum); Annual Permit $269. No thirdâ€‘party delivery; on-site, pickup, or direct delivery only.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
What to do: Confirm you can run a MEHKO at home and understand core limits.

Why it matters: You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

What you need:
- â˜ Residence in Lake County
- â˜ Menu and daily/weekly production plan
- â˜ Basic kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

Where/how: Review Lake County's MEHKO page and ordinance; limits are summarized here.

Cost & time: $0 Â· 10â€“30 minutes planning

Ready when: You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO daily meal limits
Lake County MEHKO weekly meal limits
Lake County home kitchen operations rules

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
What to do: Get your Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential and any needed property approvals.

Why it matters: Food safety certification is required and property rules may apply.

What you need:
- â˜ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- â˜ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- â˜ City business license if required in your jurisdiction

Where/how: Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; check local business license rules.

Cost & time: ~$60â€“$90 Â· 1â€“2 days total

Ready when: You have a CFPM certificate and any property/business approvals.
searchTerms: ANSI-CFP Food Protection Manager Lake County
Lake County renter permission MEHKO
Lake County business license home food operation

steps.title: Prepare Required Documents
steps.content:
What to do: Gather the documents you'll submit with your application.

Why it matters: Incomplete submissions delay approval and inspection.

What you need:
- â˜ SOP form â€” go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- â˜ Health Permit Application â€” go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- â˜ CFPM certificate (from Step 2: Approvals & Training)
- â˜ Government ID and basic business info

Where/how: Organize files (PDFs/photos) for upload or printing.

Cost & time: $0 Â· 30â€“60 minutes

Ready when: All documents are filled/signed and stored as PDFs.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO SOP requirements
Lake County MEHKO application documents
Lake County home kitchen operations forms

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
What to do: Fill the MEHKO SOP form covering menu, preparation, storage, and sanitation.

Why it matters: This shows the county how you will keep food safe at home.

What you need:
- â˜ Menu and ingredients list
- â˜ Prep/cooking/cooling/holding details
- â˜ Cleaning/sanitizing plan; handwashing setup

Where/how: Complete the SOP form in this step.

Cost & time: $0 Â· 30â€“60 minutes

Ready when: SOP is complete and consistent with your operation.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO SOP template
Lake County food safety SOP requirements
MEHKO Standard Operating Procedures Lake County

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
What to do: Complete the county Health Permit Application for a Microenterprise Home Kitchen Operation.

Why it matters: This is the official request to operate a MEHKO.

What you need:
- â˜ Owner contact and site address
- â˜ CFPM certificate details
- â˜ SOP â€” go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

Where/how: Complete the application in this step.

Cost & time: $0 to fill Â· 15â€“30 minutes

Ready when: Application is complete and matches your SOP.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO permit application
Lake County Health Permit Application form
Lake County home kitchen operations application

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
What to do: Submit the completed forms and pay required fees.

Why it matters: The county processes your permit after complete submission and payment.

What you need:
- â˜ Completed Application â€” go to Step 5: Health Permit Application
- â˜ Completed SOP â€” go to Step 4: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- â˜ CFPM certificate
- â˜ Payment method for fees

Where/how: Submit to Environmental Health; see county website for current submission options.

Cost & time: Plan Check $135/hr (1 hr min); Annual Permit $269 Â· 10â€“20 minutes

Ready when: County confirms receipt and payment.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO application fee
Lake County Environmental Health submission
Lake County MEHKO payment methods

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
What to do: Coordinate a home kitchen inspection with Environmental Health.

Why it matters: Passing inspection is required before operating.

What you need:
- â˜ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- â˜ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- â˜ All required equipment functional

Where/how: The department will provide scheduling details after application review.

Cost & time: Included in application fees Â· 1â€“2 hours on site

Ready when: You receive a pass and any corrections are resolved.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO inspection checklist
Lake County home kitchen inspection preparation
Lake County Environmental Health inspection MEHKO

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
What to do: Get your MEHKO permit after passing inspection and keep it on hand.

Why it matters: You must have a valid permit to operate.

What you need:
- â˜ Final approval notice
- â˜ Permit document

Where/how: Issued by Environmental Health after inspection approval.

Cost & time: $0 (after application fee) Â· timeline varies by case

Ready when: You have the permit and any conditions noted by the inspector.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO permit issuance
Lake County permit processing timeline
Lake County Environmental Health permit status

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
What to do: Follow your SOP and MEHKO limits; renew as required.

Why it matters: Staying within rules protects customers and your permit status.

What you need:
- â˜ Daily/weekly meal logs under limits
- â˜ Temperature & cleaning records
- â˜ Permit renewal reminder

Where/how: Keep simple records; contact the department if your menu or volume changes.

Cost & time: Renewal fees apply Â· ongoing

Ready when: You track meals, keep records, and schedule renewal on time.
searchTerms: Lake County MEHKO meal tracking requirements
Lake County MEHKO renewal process
Lake County home kitchen operations compliance

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
What to do: Use the contact information below for questions and assistance.

Why it matters: County staff can help with specific questions about your application.

What you need:
- â˜ Phone number or email for questions
- â˜ Office hours and location
- â˜ Website for additional resources

Where/how: Contact the Environmental Health division at 922 Bevins Court, Lakeport, CA 95453; phone (707) 263-1164. Visit Lake County's MEHKO webpage for current info.

Cost & time: $0 Â· varies by question complexity

Ready when: You have the information you need to proceed.
